text:
Created attachment 27857 Source Code Running the attached program from the command line, it works every time. Through Mozilla and IE at BEST, I get a response every time I send a WRONG password (“Password:”), but every other time I send a RIGHT password I get nothing back (“”). When it does work, it gives me a switch prompt (“MyName>”). Since it flip-flops through the web, I am not exactly who to report the bug to as it does work sometimes. My guess is that the open channel is not being handled correctly by the Apache Per Module Interface, but I am not sure. With “-v4a” on, I get this every time, but I never see the prompt:

Trying:WRONG

Original: debug1: Authentications that can continue: keyboard-interactive,password Password:

Trying:RIGHT

Original: debug1: Authentication succeeded (keyboard-interactive). Authenticated to 2.2.2.2 ([2.2.2.2]:22). debug1: channel 0: new [client-session] debug1: Entering interactive session. debug1: Sending environment. debug1: Sending env LANG = C

Web Client: Windows 7 Enterprise - Service Pack 1 Browser: Mozilla 7.0.1 Browser: IE 9.0.8112.16421 Update 9.0.3 (KB2586448) Web Host: Linux MYHOST 2.6.38.6-26.rc1.fc15.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon May 9 20:45:15 UTC 2011 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux Apache: 2.2.21 (Unix) Perl: 5, version 12, subversion 4 (v5.12.4) built for x86_64-linux-thread-multi Perl Module: perl-Net-SSH-Expect-1.09-5.fc15.noarch
creator: blair.copeland@untsystem.edu

text: This has nothing to do with httpd. Either open a report against the module vendor or mod_perl (if you are using it).
creator: rpluem@apache.org
